subject: Sales
title: The Mirroring Technique
description: A 60-second lesson on The Mirroring Technique.

hook.text: An FBI negotiator repeats the kidnapper's last three words. Tension drops. Dialogue opens. Mirroring.

buildup.text: Mirroring means echoing a few key words someone just said. It feels natural yet is deeply strategic.

discovery.text: Chris Voss popularized mirroring in sales. It signals understanding and invites the speaker to elaborate.

twist.text: It seems too simple to be powerful. But studies show mirroring activates trust circuits in the brain.

climax.text: Try it in meetings: repeat the buyer's key phrase as a question. They'll open up and tell you more.

punchline.text: Repeat their words. They'll tell you everything.

quiz.question: Who popularized mirroring as a sales technique?
